thread.title: Kumkum Bhagya’s Abhi-Pragya v/s us on Valentine’s Day
thread.title_full: Kumkum Bhagya’s Abhi-Pragya v/s us on Valentine’s Day

author: Anusha Iyengar
title: Kumkum Bhagya’s Abhi-Pragya v/s us on Valentine’s Day
text:
Ek Villain's Sidharth Malhotra and Shraddha Kapoor on the sets of Kumkum Bhagya - View pics! 
If only we could attend Valentine’s Day parties like they throw on television, I would have a date every year. Lots of free food and alcohol, since the ‘hosts’ of the parties will be too busy looking into each other’s eyes the entire time. And Valentine’s Day episodes on television are usually just full of stares, dances and feels. Some even enjoy rains in winter. Oh how Bollywood has ruined us! While we are all prepared to check out what the current lot on television have in store for us, here’s what ordinary people like us celebrate Valentine’s Day. (P.S. Some of us do more than just staring at each other) 
Not that I wish my Valentine’s Day was like the ones they show on TV. I would rather sit at home and wait for my boyfriend to cook something nice for me. But every time there is a V-Day episode on TV, there is this grand party with lots of heart-shaped balloon and junior artists pretending to have fun with their dates. It’s this whole Dil Toh Pagal Hai theme, where Shah Rukh Khan and Karisma Kapoor sing Pyaar Kar Ohohoho Pyaar Kar. Well, at least that’s the inspiration. But here are some things that happen on TV and DO NOT happen with us. (ALSO READ: Anita Hassanandani’s husband Rohit Reddy ACCIDENTALLY reveals the Valentine’s Day surprise planned for her – watch video ) 
The Valentine’s Day party 
Onscreen: 
Just kiss each other already! 
In real life: 
Because nothing says ‘I love you the most’ like pizza. 
The V-Day special kisss
